meanings.definition: Make or become more lively or animated.
meanings.sent1: The music was livening up the party, making everyone dance.
meanings.sent2: She livened the dull conversation by telling a funny joke.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be livening up the room by chasing a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: His energetic performance on stage was livening up the audience.
meanings.sent5: The colorful decorations livened up the plain room.

meanings.definition: To add excitement or interest to something.
meanings.sent1: The surprise guest livened up the event with their unexpected arrival.
meanings.sent2: The new movie livened up our movie night with its thrilling plot.
meanings.sent3: The magician livened up the show by pulling a rabbit out of a hat.
meanings.sent4: Her witty comments livened up the conversation at the dinner table.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display livened up the night sky with bursts of color.
